channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Category: GSOC-2014 / Tag: NEWS
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 29/07/2014
item.description:
[docs] wrote design documentation for Feedbook: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1K3-9CdqzLC9MJ97uCIrlrAeGQfrTB4KZF2GMeMlWZJE/edit?usp=sharing and https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B01dRm0dflH1QTBObXIzUG9NaTA/edit?usp=sharing
[code] deployed prose-gatekeeper to Heroku (https://gatekeeper-timvideos.herokuapp.com)
[code] compiled and deployed prose.io to GitHub pages (http://code.timvideos.us/prose/)
[code] updated document about deployment of timvideos getting-started
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: 29 July '14
item.description:
I tried deploying the app on the VM by merging skay’s commit. I installed vagrant, but it’s version 1.0.1, far from being the latest. Upgrading to the latest version needs me to remove this and reinstall the new one. Also, skay suggested that it might become heavy on the VM at some point, so I am contemplating trying deploying the app on Windows itself. I’ll try and be done with this part by tomorrow.

Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: Week 10 Progress
item.description: This week, I was eagerly waiting for some good results so I can post on this blog. I was initially working on porting of DVSwitch flumotion component. The code changes were done but stream was still giving errors that caps aren’t set or stream format is not compatible.

item.title: 28 July '14
item.description:
I talked to Sheila about getting the app up and running on a server. She’s helping me by writing fabric scripts to automate the process (something I am completely unfamiliar with). She gave me the link to a helpful blogpost for deploying a django project for the first time. It can be found here.

Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 26/07/2014 - 27/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added ability to extend feedbook without forking a gem
[code] added option to facebook notifier to use APP SECRET key (instead of default Graph API Key)
[code] added googl url shortener filter to Liquid (now it is possible to use your plugins from Jekyll that extends Liquid filters and tags in Feedbook)

[research] I did big research about GitHub Issues Tools, I tried again waffle.io, octokan.com, BugHub, ZenHub for Chrome and many others and it is really hard to find best tool for GitHub Issues, but waffle.io seems to suit all our needs. It has ability to create own Board with multiple repositories and have all Issues grouped in one place, you can add as many columns as you wish, filter by milestones, assigned, sources, etc. And there are a lot of people using it. :)

What is next/my plans to the end of GSoC 2014?
1. Work with feedbook (add Google+ integration, write offline mode and more tests to make sure, that all works correctly). [next few days]
2. Update our document about deployment process of getting-started website (and create and deploy as many as I can (because of permissions)) [tomorrow/day after tomorrow]
3. Integrate planet with getting-started.
4. Extract my written Jekyll plugins into GitHub projects and share code with the others (and add some tests of course).
5. Small CSS/HTML fixes and enhancements.
6. Add Diagram to my GitHub Issues Filter.
7. Add acceptance/integration tests for planet and getting-started website.

Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: GSoC Update 7-24 /7-25
item.description: Snippets

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 23/07/2014 - 24/07/2014
item.description:
[code] wrote more tests for feedbook gem (currently I covered 92% of all lines of code with tests)
[code] wrote YARDoc to every method inside gem to make it easier to contribute to it
[code] fixed Planet generation in case of not working GitHub API
[code] added email and irc notifier to feedbook gem

Now I need to write configuration validator, links shortener (I don't know which shortener I would like to use: goo.gl or bit.ly) and few things about configuration in README and gem will be ready to be deployed. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: 24 July '14
item.description: I spent most of the day improvising the forms and looking up better ways I could take and save a page screenshot. I have two major tasks left to do now:

item.title: GSoC Update 7-22
item.description: snippets

item.title: 23 July '14
item.description: Modified the form fields today and added a little more design to it. I learnt how to include drop-down fields in Django models.

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 22/07/2014
item.description:
[code] fixed small issues with feedbook gem, now everything should work fine. I still need some time to write tests and after it I will add email and IRC gateway. I added source code of my gem to GitHub and I will add it to rubygems after I did some tests. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: 22 July '14
item.description:
Finally had success in resolving the bug about view not loading. The url was bring masked by another. I implemented the Edit and Delete functionalities on bugs today. They are in their most basic form, for now. Every bug has an Edit and Delete button associated with it. Hitting edit takes you to a form with pre-populated data, which can be edited by the admin. Clicking Delete, deletes the bug and refreshes the page. I did some basic styling for the forms as well.

Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: Problems porting DVSwitch Flumotion component
item.description: While porting flumotion dvswitch producer, I’m stuck with a problem. Here’s the DEBUG LOG.

item.title: 21 July '14
item.description:
I have been stuck at an issue for a couple of days. I generate Edit and Delete links in django-tables2 table dynamically, but they don’t seem to work. I tried a lot of different things but nothing helps. I raised the question on Stackoverflow here. Hopefully I’ll resolve this soon.

Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: Week 9 Progress
item.description: This week, I ported dvswitch gstreamer plugin to 1.0 version. It was compiled and I tested both dvswitch source and sink plugins. Tests run properly, but I’m unable to successfully build it as a debian package.

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 20/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added command line interface, config example, simple help, and all is nearly done, all I need to do is to write more tests and test it on my own. Today I've decided to add 2 more gateways: email and irc: Why should we have more than one application to notify posts, we can have social media sites, email and IRC all together. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 19/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added Facebook and Twitter notifiers implementation, pushing to Google Plus stream is impossible, because of read-only API, added new posts comparer, getting posts from feed, etc.

Tomorrow I will add command line interface (like supybot or planet) to get all things works, then I will need some time to tests. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
